content:
Bologna has a lot of interesting places to explore beyond just its amazing food. Here are a few things you might consider adding to your itinerary:

1. Piazza Maggiore: This main square is the heart of Bologna and a great place to take in the city's history and architecture.
2. Two Towers: As symbols of the city, these towers are a must-see for visitors. The taller one, Torre degli Asinelli, offers a climb and stunning view of the city.
3. Basilica of San Petronio: One of the largest churches in the world, this basilica is located on Piazza Maggiore and features beautiful artwork and architecture.
4. Museo Civico Archeologico: This archaeological museum is home to a large collection of ancient artifacts and displays ranging from the prehistoric period to the Renaissance.
5. Porticoes: Bologna is famous for its porticoes - covered walkways that line many of the streets in the city. These are great for a leisurely stroll and offer shelter from the sun and rain.

These are just a few suggestions, but there's definitely a lot more to see and do in Bologna!
